page.title: 19Religion in Elton
page.content: Elton has an ancient parish church and a Methodist chapel. The church was founded in Saxon times, and small carvings from this period remain in the north aisle and in grave-yard crosses.The present church dates mainly from the 14th century with restoration in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The Rector who lives in the village is also responsible for the parishes of Stibbington and Water Newton. The children of this school meet in church on most Friday mornings for a short service,and also attend two School Eucharists each term,plus other special services. The Methodist chapel dates from 1864. It has a handsome stone north front. Some villagers travel to churches of various denominations in nearby towns.
